title: Should give internal temp
text:
While the Cafe 4 dr French Door refrigerator itself does not give internal temperature on the display and only shows the setpoint, the internal temperature Hass to be available to the electronics in order to run the fans and compressor. This information should be available inside the app. Right now the app only indicates if the temperature is too warm, akin to old fashion ‚Äúidiot lights‚Äú on automobiles. EDIT 8/3/21 The push notifications if a refrigerator door is open is almost instantaneous on my phone.   Other than that, the app does what it is supposed to do. 

Additionally there should be better instructions on connecting the refrigerator to Wi-Fi, noting that 5 MHz radio should be turned off on routers during the initial handshaking, as well as if there is a mesh network (much more common nowadays) all satellite mesh devices should be powered down except for the main device. This was what was necessary as confirmed by tech-support in order to connect my refrigerator to Wi-Fi.

title: Not functioning for GE washer dryer
text:
The app was awesome until the new iOS came out, now it doesn‚Äôt function properly. I was able to open the app and see thrasher and dryer active state and history, and that it was sending notifications, however the notifications do not come through. After verifying my phone settings and app setting did not change with any of the updates, I force updated my app.  When that didn‚Äôt work, I tried deleting and reinstalling my washer and dryer.  Still no cycle notifications.  Then I deleted the app and reinstalled it, and I cannot log back in, it says the password is incorrect.  So I attempted to reset the password via the forgotten password link, and that seemed successful, but when I try to log back in I get a message that says ‚Äúinvalid credentials‚Äù.  
The Wi-Fi cycle notifications may seem like a minor thing, but for me, a forgetful person with a lot going on, they are a lifesaver.  Yesterday I completely forgot a load of towels in the washer, and had to rewash them today because they sat overnight and half the morning and already didn‚Äôt smell fresh again. It‚Äôs a total bummer that this isn‚Äôt working and hasn‚Äôt been for a little over a week now.  I don‚Äôt have an issue with any of my other apps, so I‚Äôm pretty sure it‚Äôs the app and not my phone.

title: Prettier but not much better
text: I was glad to see the rebranding of GE‚Äôs awkwardly-named GE U+ Connect app to something a little more streamlined. It‚Äôs prettier, sure, but I‚Äôm not sure it really delivers what I want as a connected appliance owner. First off, SmartHQ and the associated icon tells me nothing as I‚Äôm swiping through apps trying to find the one that operates my appliances. Second, the capabilities really haven‚Äôt gotten any better for my connected Microwave. I stopped getting notifications over a year ago, and they‚Äôve never started up again. The library of products I can scan to cook in the microwave also seems to have stagnated, and multi-step cooks just don‚Äôt work beyond the first heating stage. As I added new washers and dryers, it took me forever to find the option to rename each so I could tell them apart. And this app still only supports one home, so appliances between my primary and vacations homes are all mixed in together. This is GE and Haier. I expect better from a name of this caliber. It suggests that Haier, like so many other connected product manufacturers, just isn‚Äôt dedicating the budget and talent to this app that‚Äôs necessary to continue to add value beyond just plugging in new product models.

title: Happy with my W/Düíô
text:
So far I have no complaints for my washer or dryer. They clean and dry extremely well, with plenty of options in each appliance. We opted for the washer without the self dispensing detergent feature because we were concerned about the tubes, etc. becoming clogged with detergent overtime. We saw no indication that this possibility was addressed with a flushing system after each wash and that‚Äôs probably needed if they want to have that handy feature without burdening buyers with future repairs but we could‚Äôve overlooked something. All that said, that is literally the only feature I would want to add. Well, they need to continue working on the ventilation system to dry the area around the door seal after each wash. I don‚Äôt really see how that‚Äôs doing a whole lot? To avoid the possibility of mold, we try to be diligent about letting the door air out at the end of our wash week or wipe it down. Not a super big deal. 
All in all, a solid machine so far, enjoying the WiFi feature that notifies me when loads are ‚úÖ.

title: Fixed my issues with the ge app
text: I downloaded this app because the ge app became broken and still has not been updated or fix. This app allowed me to once again use the smart features I payed extra for on my ge ac. However I have a few things I don‚Äôt like one is the adds I rent so most of the smart devices out there are not worth my investment because I don‚Äôt own the property, the app recently now bothers me every time I use it to give it Bluetooth access on my phone yet my ac dos t have so there is no need for that access for me asking one and saying no should be enough not every time, the old ge app I had would show me the estimated usage by both the total day but I could also see by the hour it let me fine tune my settings through out the day as I have to use it a lot in the summer so my dog is comfortable while we are at work I do miss that.

title: Wow
text: We had the choice of other softeners, and having the ability to access information via WiFi seemed like a good idea, with smart home integration. It says how many days of salt are remaining and so forth, and said it would detect leaks. Well that sounds all good and well, and sounded like somewhat of a gimmick. Much to my surprise as doing things around the house, an alert was sent to my phone showing that a medium flow rate was detected and to check appliances and water connections. Turned out to be a toilet in our newly built house that wasn‚Äôt completely sealed when refilling. That alone makes us super happy to have Purchased such a great appliance. Additionally we‚Äôve never had a softener and it sure is nice to not have to use as much shampoo or clean glass, etc near as vigorously. 6 days owned, already satisfied.

title: Good but can be better
text: We have 2 appliances linked to the app, our range and refrigerator. The rang was built in, and if this review was just for that it would be 5 stars. Love the pre heat and timer complete pop up on phone. Based on that (and no easy way to control/know the temperature) we purchased the plug in unit for the refrigerator. For everything it does one would think that if the door was open it would pop up on the app. It does not. Knowing that and being out of ear shot of the fridge would make the purchase a no brainer. At this point I would caution anyone purchasing the wifi enabler not to. The only other function that would be great is since the range and microwave communicate it would be great if those alerts would come through the app. Sadly the dishwasher we bought in the set is a model below compatibility.

title: Pointless app for a Cafe Refrigerator
text:
The only thing the app does for the fridge is allow you to schedule hot water or notify you if the door is left open. On the fridge and in the app, there is no real-time temperature display even though I know it has precision sensors. I know this because I can ‚Äúhack‚Äù a way to display the current fridge and freezer temps by changing the current fridge and freezer settings. Doing this will display current temperature. It would also be great to be able to see how long it will take the refrigerator to get back down to the current setting after new food has been loaded or the doors were left open for too long. It would also be good to know if that time is longer than ok for food safety reasons.

Oh yeah, and there‚Äôs a feedback option in the app that literally doesn‚Äôt work. Doesn‚Äôt do anything. You type your feedback and then it doesn‚Äôt accept the submission

title: Useful and in need of improvement
text:
We got this app to enable our new Hestan Cue pan to work with our range. We are enjoying the control that it offers, but getting used to it was harder than it needs to be. 
Pros: the precision cooking that this app makes possible, and the recipes and suggestions that it offers.
Cons: instructions for syncing the pan with our range were not clear; it took quite a while and some persistence before we figured out how it was supposed to work.  And the recipes are difficult to follow ‚Äî not because of ingredients or technique, but because of the way they are written into the app. Having to click through all the successive steps one by one (some of which provide no information at all!) in order to figure out what‚Äôs going on is simply ridiculous.

title: Update: app works now
text:
Update: now the app works. They have fixed the password issue. I do love this app. It‚Äôs very convenient. 

Previous review: 
I used to be able to use the app for my ge washer. My husband and I both had the app. I didn‚Äôt realize that it had updated. He was using his. I kept trying to connect to the washer and kept getting to the last step. When I try to enter my WiFi password, the app will bounce and not allow me to enter it. I uninstalled and reinstalled thinking it would work. No go. Same issue. I asked my husband to disconnect. Still no go. Now I‚Äôm thinking I shouldn‚Äôt have had him disconnect because I think that when he comes back he won‚Äôt be able to connect again.

title: App no longer works‚Ä¶ Again
text:
This is the second app that no longer works from this company‚Ä¶ The first all stopped working and I had to use the other 1-star reviews in order to find this app to use my window Air Conditioner. Now after using this app for a few months, I attempt to open the app and connect to change my settings, and it ‚Äúcannot connect to wifi‚Äù. I tried everything and still nothing. Delete and reinstall and app and it just gets stuck on a blank screen when you click sign in. I am now unable to use my appliance yet again due to another alp not working‚Ä¶ Hopefully I like it either on full blast, or off. How hard is it to make an app that works properly? A group of high-schoolers could do it better than this entire company.

If you do not already own a GE appliance and you are reading this, DO NOT waste your money on this dumpster-fire, I am begging you

If you do already own a GE appliance: Good luck!

title: Super Annoying Bluetooth Request
text:
I have a GE Cafe range.  It is wifi.  It has no Bluetooth.  I foolishly accepted an app upgrade for the old Chef Connect, and I wish I hadn‚Äôt.  

Each and every time I go to use my app, I get an annoying popup, wanting me to go to settings to allow the app to use my Bluetooth.  I have no intention of allowing the app to use my Bluetooth.  My range does not communicate via Bluetooth and I wouldn‚Äôt dream of allowing Alexa or Google to control my device so I am not really sure why I need to be asked this Bluetooth question each and every time I go to use the app.   

My suggestion for the developers is to allow a user to make their choice and then leave them alone.  If for some reason a user wants to change their mind, they can always go back into their settings and select ‚Äúallow‚Äù for the app to use Bluetooth.  Otherwise, stop pestering.

title: Nice
text: I‚Äôve really been enjoying this app and remotely being able to control and monitor my window unit both on and off my WiFi. I did have to preform a reset about a week into having it setup but haven‚Äôt had an issue since then. I live in a tiny home that‚Äôs close cell foam insulated so it doesn‚Äôt take long for it to be cooled. I can turn the unit off while working then remotely turn the AC back on on my way home if needed so it‚Äôs nice an cool when I walk in. Also being able to monitor power usage is another great feature. I‚Äôll admit I was skeptical about a window unit with WiFi an originally thought it was a dumb idea, but GE made me a believer. It‚Äôs well thought out and very user friendly.

title: Blind guy and his double Oven
text: For most the WiFi controlled appliances are something that is not life changing.  For the blind, it can mean the difference between dependency and independence.  Before getting this oven I had to get somebody to come and help turn it on and to the right temperature.  Typically this involved calling the neighbor kids who would gladly help, but they  grew up and found different ways to spend their time.  When this capability came out I was in the process of renovations of my kitchen and decided to try this.  I‚Äôll never go back.  The abilities and capabilities this provides is unparalleled .  The only concern I have is the too often updating of the app which often takes a couple of attempts to repair the accessibility issues.

title: Huge miss. GE Profile - Opal 2.0 Ice Maker. Need to have push notifications for low water level.
text: Love the ice maker but this app is pretty pointless. It can control 3 functions: Power On/Off, Lighting Off/Dim/On, and Schedule. The first two I find easier and faster to control by simply using the buttons on the machine. I don‚Äôt have any use for the scheduling feature at all as I like to make several batches of ice ahead of time and store in the freezer. What the devs / product mgr really need to make this app useful is the ability to send a push notification when the water level starts getting low. As it is now, there is no way to tell other than visually checking the machine and often times will forget and then the machine shuts off, which is a drag because it takes a long time for it to cycle back up and start making ice again.

title: Weak Effort
text: Ok you‚Äôre a techie and that‚Äôs why you have the app. Past that this app is nearly worthless. I have it connected to my oven, you have to press ‚Äúremote‚Äù on the oven to activate. Ok I can handle. But then if you don‚Äôt use the feature within 12 hours or you open the oven door it turns off. So why even offer this feature?  It should allow access all the time, at least when the remote feature is enabled. Whenever I  want to use the app and the feature is disabled. Who remembers to turn it on every morning in case you want to use later that day?  And don‚Äôt work late because it shuts off in 12 hours. Like I said worthless attempt to be hi-tech. Haven‚Äôt figured out if any benefit for dishwasher or fridge. I think it‚Äôs GE just trying to get marketing data without any real value. Unless knowing your filter or rinse side needs replacement. I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôre ready to sell you.

title: I liked the Comfort-GE app better
text: First of all, I wasn‚Äôt even aware that the old app had been replaced with this new app. Guess that explains why the old app started crashing every time I opened it. Now on to this new app-it looks cool, but there‚Äôs some things wrong with it. First, it doesn‚Äôt have a ‚ÄúROUTINES‚Äù option where I can set my window A/C unit to whatever temp when I‚Äôm home, away, sleep, or vacation. The old app offered this whereas this new one doesn‚Äôt. Secondly, the ‚ÄúSCHEDULE‚Äù options won‚Äôt let you delete an unneeded schedule-all it does is state ‚Äúthere is an issue-please try again later‚Äù. That‚Äôs annoying as he**! You can‚Äôt even toggle it off and actually SAVE it. Also, there‚Äôs no location option either, which would coincide with a ROUTINES function. This app could be really good‚Ä¶but it looks cool‚Ä¶..guess that gets the 2 stars.

title: More frustrating than it should be
text:
I have 3 issues with this app at present, including being unable to submit feedback to them!

1. Everytime I launch the app, it asks for Bluetooth access. This needs to go immediately. I denied the request initially because none of the appliances I have connected require bluetooth and it repeatedly asking for access is just obnoxious.

2. Add some sort of ‚Äúcheck for and apply firmware updates‚Äù button. I pretty much only launch this app when I need to actually use the appliance and I don‚Äôt have the time to apply an update at that moment, so I say ‚Äúlater‚Äù to the pop up. When I go back to apply the update, I cannot figure out how to manually trigger that update; it seems to only ask to update when I launch the app again about 24 hours after the last time I told it ‚Äúlater‚Äù, which is usually exactly when I actually need to use it again and again don‚Äôt have time to apply an update.

3. The ‚ÄúFeedback‚Äù submission is broken. After I fill it out and hit ‚Äúsubmit‚Äù, nothing happens. The button appears to press but it stays on the same screen, with everything still filled out, and literally nothing indicates that anything was submitted.

title: This app is terrible too
text: I have the GE smart AC. Everything was perfect and everything worked well until they decided to crash the other app and apparently move to this one (which you only found out from reading the hundreds of one star reviews). This one is absolutely terrible too. First, it‚Äôs ugly. It‚Äôs so ugly. I‚Äôve never seen a more disgusting selection of colors and I truly hate to even open it. Second, it‚Äôs basically useless as well. I‚Äôve lost several functions of my AC now, such as the geofence. I can‚Äôt set a schedule at all. Every time I try to save one, it creates something completely different. The point of spending more money for a smart AC was to be able to control it while away from home, and they‚Äôve decided to make their apps suddenly so terrible you can‚Äôt do that. I‚Äôm truly disgusted. I‚Äôll never buy another GE product if I can help it.

title: Really bad app, very hard to set up
text:
Well, if you really keep insisting on me giving a review, here you go:
Besides the fact that the GE air conditioner is the loudest ac I ever bought and will probably not be used a lot this app made the experience even worse.
It‚Äôs super hard to set up an account. The password check doesn‚Äôt work well, it says your password is approved but it fails to mention there‚Äôs a limit on the length. You have to figure that out yourself.
Then you get confirmation mails that look like fishing mails, who is Haier, or Gigya-Raas? My machine says GE, so I expect mail from them.
Then the WiFi setup is really complicated, the wizard does not help at all. ‚ÄúIs the WiFi light on or blinking?‚Äù Well, it‚Äôs off, what do I do now? I‚Äôve had to type in the units password at least 10 times before I got it working. I‚Äôm a software engineer, that didn‚Äôt even help.

title: Can‚Äôt control, doesn‚Äôt send notifications
text:
Ever since shifting to this new app, my GE washer/dryer no longer send me notifications (yes, I‚Äôve given the app permission on my phone) or let me control them remotely. I can see usage data, but no ability to control them. Basically every reason you‚Äôd want a ‚Äúsmart‚Äù washer/dryer is completely nonfunctional with this new app.

EDIT: I got a friendly response from someone after I posted this who told me a number to call. I talked with a super friendly agent, and all it took was deleting the app and reinstalling it to resolve the issue. Now it works like it should, and I bumped the stars up to 5.

title: Set-up procedure lacking
text:
Gave it 3 stars for lack of clear instructions as to linking range to the app.  When I attempted to link my new range with the Smart App, the step-by-step instructions that came with my range didn‚Äôt work.  
I found success by going through the link in an email from GE when I registered my range on-line with the GE website.  
Would be great to be able to download app and then have an option to link an appliance.  When I downloaded app from Google Play, there was no feature in the app to add an appliance. 
So far, the app is convenient to use to start oven preheat.  I‚Äôve used it to start a timer as well.  
The app seems to function well.

title: Very pleased!
text: I‚Äôve had this slide in induction/oven range for about six months and couldn‚Äôt be more pleased. In fact I hope to buy another one for my vacation home based on this experience. The good. Fast preheating, new air Fry feature through a download (!), great temperature control on cooktop, love the induction cooktop, easy to clean. The smaller top oven is big enough for 75% of all my cooking.  The app works As promised and it‚Äôs great to have alerts when preheating or cooking is done. I haven‚Äôt used it to start preheating when away from home because preheating is so fast. But I could!  I haven‚Äôt been a GE appliance fan for years, but I‚Äôm a convert.

title: Not a lot of options
text:
I have a nice washer and dryer set but the app barely has any options. You can‚Äôt start you washer or dryer from the app and you can‚Äôt change any settings once either gets going. You can extend you dryer time and that‚Äôs it. If you have smart dispense on your washer, you won‚Äôt be able to see how much detergent you have left unless you sign up for the tide auto order program. I hate that....this is not something sponsored by tide, it‚Äôs a feature of the GE machine. I should be able to see what‚Äôs left without signing up for a delivery program. Please fix this and make more interactive features in the app. Other than watching what cycle you‚Äôre in and cutting things off, it doesn‚Äôt have a purpose. 

Disappointed and expected better features.

title: Love it but‚Ä¶annoyed at the same time
text: Love the app , ease of use, and connectivity for my washer and dryer, and believe me it‚Äôs becoming far more useful than one would anticipate, but I wish I could tailor the notifications for each connected appliance. In some cases, I get too many, too often. My only annoyance with my washer is that if clothes sit too long before opening/transferring the clothes, the automatic ventilation doesn‚Äôt trigger. Being an automatic feature, it would be easy to overlook. I‚Äôm finding the venting feature essential so this is a critical for me. I think this is something that could be addressed in an app/appliance update? Overall though, very happy

title: App works but wish it did more
text:
I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs our washer and dryer or if it‚Äôs the app but there‚Äôs not many options I wish it would do more than tell me how long until the cycle is done. 
Also if the washer and dryer is off I can‚Äôt use the app to turn it on to start the laundry, I still actually have to push the power button on the machine. If I could turn it on when I‚Äôm not at home and I can leave laundry ready to go and push start on the app and then it will be finished when I got home. Again not sure if that‚Äôs just our washer and dryer system or if it‚Äôs something that could be added to the app but it would be amazing.

title: How to connect your double wall oven to WiFi
text: This app is flawed.  I spent an hour trying to connect my brand new GE double wall oven to wifi and the app kept failing and throwing errors that it couldn‚Äôt connect to the GE appliance‚Äôs network.  Whether you choose LCD display oven or touch pad oven in the menu, none of them will work.  The key I found out, is to screw trying to select your oven in the stupid menus.  Just go into the Cafe brand of products and choose dishwasher, then follow the prompts.  You‚Äôll see a totally different interface that actually asks you for the appliance network password and network module name.  Magically, if you enter this info and follow the prompts, it connects and works, and yes the app knows you are connecting an oven, making all of the pre-menus to select the type of product completely pointless. GE needs to fix this app.  It‚Äôs a mess.

title: Where‚Äôs my dryer?
text:
App seems to work OK for the washer but shows nothing with regards to the dryer! Oh yeah ... that‚Äôs right ... we don‚Äôt have one yet ... we‚Äôve been WAITING 5 MONTHS FOR THE DRYER and it‚Äôs still not here ... that‚Äôs probably why it doesn‚Äôt show. What‚Äôs the problem?  

UPDATED REVIEW- I just got a reply to this review so I would like to update this review to be only a single half-star now.  You don‚Äôt send the same cut and paste junk to someone reporting a 5-month old problem unless your company is so inept that this is a recurring problem.  You don‚Äôt tell someone to do something they have certainly done at least a dozen times already over the past 5-month.  What you do is open up your mind to the chance that YOU, GE Appliance, ARE THE PROBLEM, AND THEN DO SOMETHING TO FIX IT.  Your email response was useless!  It contained nothing that has already not be tried.

title: Great idea - Poor Implementatoon
text: This is a pretty good app when it works.  Took 7 times and three email addresses to get this to finally connect for the first time.  Though the documentation claims you can use multiple ios devices to connect, it is not possible.  When you try to connect another device, it creates a connection with a different ip address rendering the original connection useless because there is no way to adjust the ip address once it is set up.  Thus it can pair to only one device at a time which is rather inconvenient if you have a family where you have more than one individual who cooks.  The functionality of the one device works well for what is intended, but falls short of ideal life in this technological world.

title: GE WiFi Appliance Plus Junk Smart HQ App Equals ‚ÄúF‚Äù
text:
Failed! After investing in top-shelf, high-tech appliances, we are faced with an archaic app whose main objective is to collect your data and especially your location. You cannot even start trying to set up an appliance without allowing location services.
What should‚Äôve been an easy 5-minute wi-fi IoT setup became wasted time. After spending (wasting) a couple hours trying to get this junk app to connect to several of our GE appliances, we gave up and deleted the app. This should be a huge embarrassment to mega-company GE that Haier could not offer its customers a seamless setup to access the technology which we paid for. Shame on you GE and Haier for releasing this junk app.
It would not setup 3 different appliances, could not be configured in any way and is not worth the wasted time and effort.

title: Needs a complete rewrite.
text:
I am a software engineer with expertise in user experience design and usability. This app performs the necessary functions, and I appreciate the capabilities, but I would have done literally everything about it differently. I don‚Äôt normally write app reviews, but this one is so bad and I don‚Äôt have a choice to use anything else unless I replace all of my appliances that I felt compelled to say something. I don‚Äôt even know where to begin with my feedback. Throw everything away and start over. 

Honor the system dark mode. Name the app something related to the brand. Rework the interface and flow for adding a new appliance. Rework the flow for starting the laundry on a delay. Let me configure which notifications I want and when. And sooooo many more‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

title: App does not control what it says
text: We got the GE Opal 2.0 Nugget ice maker. Down loaded the app because it stated you can set up a schedule when to have the machine make ice and be able to power it on and off. You can use the app to power it off and on, turn the light on and to see the status of what‚Äôs it‚Äôs doing. I set up a schedule for 12 hours on and 12 hours off that way you can use most of the ice that it makes instead of just the new ice. Does not work. Had it on a schedule as soon as the bin is full and you take some ice it starts to make ice again even though it‚Äôs not supposed to according to the schedule. The app is not worth downloading. You might as well just turn on the machine when you want it to make nice. Disappointing....

title: The one thing I wish I knew
text: I LOVE MY OVEN and I LOVE the app that goes with it. The ONE thing I wish I had known is that when the app asks if you‚Äôd like to update, it will also update the oven itself. This update can take up to 30 minutes and if you click ‚Äúnow‚Äù, it doesn‚Äôt matter if both ovens are turned on with food inside, the whole oven will turn off and update. I ruined the whole first meal I cooked using both ovens because I wrongly thought the update would only affect the app. Now that I know this important piece of information, I am back to being delighted by this new amazing oven which makes me feel like a Jetson.

title: Great appliances, lame app
text: I enjoy the notifications that my wash is almost done, but there is no other wifi functionality on the washer as advertised. Hitting ‚Äúdelay wash‚Äù on my machine does nothing to bring up any remote control panel on the app as stated in instructions for my model. It would be useful if I got the notification my wash was done and I could then use the remote to turn it to ‚Äútumble care‚Äù but no. We have a Cafe fridge & the app is even more useless for that. As hundreds of other reviews have stated, it would be nice to see the actual temperature in all compartments (for peace of mind after a power outage has been restored for instance) but instead we can only see the temperature its set at. I already know what temperature it is set at because I set it.

title: One trick pony. Connection set up poor.
text:
Getting this app connected to my GE appliance was very difficult. I ended up calling support and found the app photos did not match my appliance, the in-app directions ambiguous, and the soft in-app keyboard for entering the network information was unusable. After 3rd phone call I got to helpful support staff and got connected to my appliance.

Once installed I really like the washer-is-done notifications. Nothing else in the app in very interesting to me. I use HomeKit and this app does NOT support HomeKit. So, this app does one trick only! I will probably never open it again, but I will get notifications when my wash is done and that makes this app useful if you want to put up with the set up.  Otherwise, don‚Äôt bother.

title: A UX Nightmare
text:
I work in IT and I‚Äôm setting this up for my mother. The whole process is a user experience nightmare. The appliance‚Äôs display says to download an app with a name and icon that do not exist. In the oven‚Äôs instruction booklet, we‚Äôre told to go to a website, where we‚Äôre then instructed to download a different app. In that app, we‚Äôre guided through a setup process that is only very loosely resembling what our appliance is mirroring. ‚ÄúHold the remote connect button until this icon flashes.‚Äù Yet holding this button does nothing. ‚ÄúGo to your phone‚Äôs Wi-Fi settings and select network ABC.‚Äù We do this, return to this app, where it tells us, ‚ÄúWrong network selected,‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt allow us to proceed. I‚Äôve hit a wall. This is a very poor app that I cannot get to connect to my appliance at all. 

0 stars.

title: Intuitive, but slow and often fails
text:
Using this with a GE Range.  While the interface is nice and simple, it is amazingly slow.  I think it goes out to the internet for every single step‚Ä¶and there are a lot of steps.  The final part is ‚Äúlooking for you appliance in the cloud‚Äù and it fails nearly every time.  We live in the country, so like many app developers, they assume everyone works in a lab with high-speed access.  
Nope.  Not out here.  It will occasionally work if I sling it though the phone, but that‚Äôs impractical for normal operation.  Anytime we have to reset the router, the range needs reconnected and the app makes it a pain.   The Wi-Fi Range is great when it works, but I regret buying the Wi-Fi version now because of the app.

title: So easy to keep track of laundry
text: We didn‚Äôt buy our washer and dryer because of the WiFi capability - I honestly thought that was a waste of time. As it turns out, I use the app all the time. Instead of running into the laundry room every 5 minutes to see if it‚Äôs time to switch the load, I can see it from my phone in any room and not waste my time. The reminder that the washer has damp laundry in it is great. It‚Äôs amazing how often I forget that I left a load in there. Is it a need to have? Maybe not, but it is really nice to have it.

title: Who knew my washing machine had so much to tell me?
text: I expected that it would be nice to get a ‚Äúheads up‚Äù to head to the laundry room because the washer is ready to be unloaded, but the first load, I forgot to set up a reminder, and I only remembered that I forgot when my washer told me I had 5 minutes to go all by itself, automatically. I now also know if someone else in the house has something in the wash before I carry a full basket of laundry down 2 flights of stairs. It‚Äôs become one of those things i didn't know I would learn to appreciate so quickly.

title: Cannot rename appliances
text: This app is a good idea, but some of its implementation is flawed. For example, I have three GE window A/C units I have connected through the app. Each one is simply called ‚ÄúAir Conditioner‚Äù by default and I cannot rename them (which a lot of other similar smart device apps allow you to do), so there‚Äôs no way to distinguish the three A/C units from each other just by looking at the app. This is an issue when I am trying to just turn on one A/C remotely and not all of them. It‚Äôs quite annoying and turns my 5-star review to a 3-star. Should be a relatively easy fix for the app developers, I hope it‚Äôs fixed in a future update!

title: App needs setting for notification sound times
text: I love having notifications with sound so if I‚Äôm doing some thing I know my laundry is complete‚Ä¶ However I do not want notifications at 6 o‚Äôclock in the morning going off on my phone while I‚Äôm sleeping and waking us up. This happens every time we set our machine to do a venting cycle. It completes early in the morning and goes off. I don‚Äôt have to turn sounds off and I don‚Äôt get sounds for the notifications that I do want. There should be a setting on this app so that you can have a sleep time when it cannot make sounds for notification

title: Terrible App
text:
This app is horrible. Upon purchasing our GE appliances I immediately set them up with this app. And yet every time I try to log into the app it makes me reenter all the model numbers and serial numbers. And then to make matters worse the oven controls don‚Äôt appear to work in the app. The oven shows as off. When I try to turn it on in the app the control still says off. But the really dangerous thing is: it in fact does turn the oven on. But then you have no way of knowing if the oven is actually on. I was trying to turn it on one day from work and it showed as off in the app. But then when I got home it had been on   Soooooo dangerous. 
Had I known this crappy app was the only one compatible with GE appliances I would have bought a different brand of appliances.

title: Ge Dryer would not connect- fixed
text:
The app connected the first time. A year later we changed our wifi password but there is no way to change that in the app. So I deleted the app and the settings. Reloaded the app and tried to connect, but the page where you put in the WiFi password will not let me use the keyboard. 
I called the support line.  It was a known bug for that device in the app. They walked me through a work around by telling the app it was a washing machine not a dryer and it connected.
Changed rating to 4 stars because it is back to working fine.

title: Convenient
text: I like this app because it gives me the ability to preheat oven when I am not home so when I get home there is no need to wait. However often I will get an update notice when I open the app, which can take 30 minutes or so preventing me from doing anything. Also 2 updates significantly lowered the volume of the timer ad it can barely be heard.  When I used control panel & pushed volume settings it went elsewhere and I could not adjust.  Last update that feature came back on control panel however even at maximum volume, the timer and other alerts can hardly be heard.

title: Love my GE range! But the app‚Ä¶.
text: I love my Profile GE range. I love the oven, it heats up so quickly and I love the induction stove top. It cleans like a dream. But the app, it‚Äôs very helpful except it does not tell me when I remove food and forget to turn the oven off. There is no red light anywhere on the control to tell me the oven is on,So, when I am cleaning up the whole kitchen, it just looks like the regular gray colored numbers on the top. It would be very helpful to have a red light somewhere that tells me it‚Äôs still on, I was hoping the app would remind me the oven was on after so many hours of being turned on. Yeah- well- i still love my my Profile GE induction  range!

title: Worked at first; no longer
text:
When they updated from the Comfort app to this one, at first it worked even better. That was only a short month ago (July 2021). It‚Äôs now August 2021 and the app (yes, Ive updated it, I‚Äôm not an idiot) works only half the time, if that. I set it to 68 for my air conditioner when I‚Äôm leaving work: it reads 74 degrees. And continues to. I come home: its actually 68 degrees in the bedroom.

What gives, GE? This is clearly broken. I can‚Äôt get it to the temperature I set it to in the app and when I set it by hand, the app still reads wrong for the room temp. I work far away and need to set it before I go home: it‚Äôs 50:1 if it‚Äôs going to actually be at a livable temperature when I get there. WHY IS THIS BROKEN, ALREADY? (Yes, I‚Äôve deleted it and redownloaded it. Twice.)

title: Functional, but messy
text:
The app shows you ads RIGHT from the first page. They made it so showcase their company & products rather than to be helpful to the end user.

There are tabs along the bottom and TWO of them (Recipes & Extras) are for advertising. Come on guys. Stop milking your audience for every penny.

You can get to your controls by the first screen after tapping your device OR via another tab called control‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶.by why should you have to take extra steps to get there? Just out the controls on the front screen for folks who only have *1* connected device & then make it simpler if they have multiple devices by opening to a device screen instead.

This isn‚Äôt complicated. Stop advertising your audience into a headache & GIVE them control over their purchases appliances.

I‚Äôm already considering taking mine back & getting a 3rd ‚ÄúMidea‚Äù portable a/c.

I gave this app 2 stars ONLY because it does actually operate the unit.

Get a redesign GE‚Ä¶.. and drop the money grab.

Oh, and your unit was VERY difficult to remove from the box.

title: To early to be honest about app
text: I‚Äôve only had the new washer and dryer for 2 weeks, but so far it hasn‚Äôt changed the way I do laundry. The ringer on the units are both much quieter than my previous models, so I guess I like being able to see where the washer and dryer are at during operations. However, I hate the fact these apps are really designed to follow your typical day running errands. The stores and places you visit. They are basically accumulating demographics on our spending habits, so they can flood our email/phone with sales. So I always deny location access.

title: App does not work
text: At this point, I‚Äôm not sure if the problem is the app or my washer dryer. My app constantly shows the washer as ‚Äúoffline‚Äù even though it‚Äôs clearly on and washing a load of clothes. I have redownloaded the app, reconnected the washer multiple times, called customer service, but to no avail. It will work sometimes but then not work after a couple of times. It‚Äôs infuriating. And that‚Äôs just the washer. On the dryer, it will ask me if I want to extend the tumble dry feature. I say yes, and nothing happens. Not sure what is going on. There‚Äôs been a few app updates since our purchase in October. None of the updates have fixed the problem. In fact, there have only been more issues with each additional update.

title: Does not work as intended for GE profile oven
text: The app is useless and dangerous. It shows OFF my GE profile wall oven is in fact ON and even when I turn the oven ON through the app. Last night, it sent several notifications saying my kitchen timer from the oven was complete. It also sent multiple notifications my oven was preheated. The problem was these notifications were overnight and woke me up at 2 am and later and caused me to worry my oven was ON in the middle of the night. I had to get out of bed multiple times overnight to physically check the oven. In fact, the timer was completed hours before bedtime  and the oven was (thankfully) OFF. I will now disconnect the WiFi from the app and delete it as it is quite incredibly useless.

title: It‚Äôs just ok
text: It‚Äôs ok. Nothing fancy. I use it for GE portable AC units. So frustrating you actually have to turn the unit on to check the ambient temperature in the room. You‚Äôd think with today‚Äôs technology, I‚Äôd be able to see the temperature in the room without having to do that. Many times I find myself turning the unit off and on several times  a day just based on the room temp. This is all done remotely which is nice. However I should be able to see the room temp before turning it on. Pretty basic features but then again it‚Äôs for a portable AC. Not like it has a built in stereo or something. Lol

title: App hardly works
text: I have only successfully been able to use the app for my oven less than 5 times in the last two months. Every time I try to use it it tells me ‚Äúrecipe can‚Äôt be edited remotely‚Äù. The oven wasn‚Äôt even on.  When I click on scan it already has some cookie recipe in it and wants to preheat the oven to 375 degrees. If I try to edit the temp after I click on the it tells me again ‚Äúrecipe can‚Äôt be edited remotely‚Äù. It‚Äôs worthless. It‚Äôs frustrating to me to think I‚Äôm paying for something extra on my appliance when it never works. This app is completely worthless‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ oh wait. I can turn the lights on in the oven anytime I want. That‚Äôs the only thing that actually works every time with no issues. üôÑ

title: At least better than main GE application
text:
Update 3‚Ä¶
If I am having this issue there are thousands having similar issues.  Hire developers who know what they are doing and hav an application that works correctly developed and tested.  It is not my job to do this work for you.  I am the customer and will remember this experience when I shop for my next appliance which now looks like it will NOT be from GE. 

Update 2. Schedule didn‚Äôt actually take affect in the morning either. So another useless application be GE. Update Well it seems that the very first schedule switch did not actually work. So again what is the point? Sigh. ********* So far at least it doesn‚Äôt crash. I will update again later.

title: Water softener monitoring not working
text:
Ios15.1.1 this app was working with both of my appliances, oven and water softener, before the last GE update. Now the only appliance I can monitor is the over. I contacted your help line and was told it‚Äôs a problem with the app and there were a lot of people where having the same problem and they are working on it and will be fixed soon. If a lot of people are having this problem then when will soon be? It‚Äôs been a few weeks now and the problem still has not been fixed.
Can you guys get someone on this problem like right now,  since a lot of people have this same problem.

title: Nuisance and they‚Äôre tracking you
text: Removed the app today. Stupid washer kept running and turning itself on. Wasting water wearing out the motor and noisy.  It needs updating every day to keep it from running on its own. The whole setup process was a great bother and took two days. The only ‚Äúbenefit ‚Äú of having an app for a washer is so it can email you when it finishes.  Then of course you will find it keeps tracking every time you use it, down to the cycle you chose. On the surface this is for compiling data so GE can market to you but how much damage could someone do if they decided you use too much electricity or water or you didn‚Äôt fall in step with some mandate and they can control your appliances? No. Just no.

title: No control just notification (washer and dryer)üëé
text: I purchased a washer and dryer which says I can control the washer and dryer with the app. This is not true. You can not start or stop or do much of anything with the app it‚Äôs just a notification thing. What a let down. False advertising or misleading for sure. If you are buying the washer thinking you could set a timer or start the wash just before your drive home think again. I would not be hard for them to allow it but it does not work like that at all. If you were thinking you could receive a notification that the cycle is complete than this app is the one for you

title: Would like a pause button and notification options
text: I would like to be able to pause/restart my washer via the app. There‚Äôs a pause button on the washer, so idk why this wouldn‚Äôt be possible. That would be a very handy addition. Also, my phone didn‚Äôt alert me at all when the cycles changed or when the washer finished. I would prefer to be able to choose to be alerted. I think that would be a helpful update. I do like the app though. I think it will be handy. Would just like more options :)

title: Impressed
text: I have never experienced a washer and dryer as such!!!! This is the absolute best ever! From the Wi-Fi to the easiest wash and dry experience ever!!! I honestly wish the app did more but it works fine. At first connecting the Wi-Fi was difficult due to the GE not being a secure connection. Other than that this ride has been pretty easy. I hope my washer and dryer stays up‚ù§Ô∏è. Thank you AARONS for delivering my appliance and working so diligently with me. Thank you GE for creating such a wonderful user friendly washer and dryer.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work well with Gas Stovetop
text: Using IFTTT I am able to get the smart switch to turn the exhaust fan on when the oven is turned on. That works great. But I can not do this for the gas stovetop. The app can see that the stovetop is on but will not send that info to IFTTT. There is no option for the stovetop in IFTTT just the oven. This appears to be a problem with the app communication with IFTTT and not IFTTT directly. Wish it would work that way the family would not have to remember to turn the exhaust fan on when cooking(which they rarely remember). Externally vented exhaust fans should always be turned on when cooking, lots of years experience in a restaurant and you could always tell when we forgot to turn it on.

title: Would be great if they add ‚Äúpause‚Äù capability
text:
We recently purchased a GE smart washer that has SmartHQ app support. 
I don‚Äôt normally use the app, but found a great use for the app today. With COVID WFH rules, I was presenting to a large meeting in my basement whilst the washing machine was running. I figured ... let me pause the machine from the app to avoid the noise. 
Unfortunately, the SmartHQ app doesn‚Äôt allow you to Pause ... the only control is to turn off the washing machine, which completely turns it off...   so if you were in the middle of a wash, the machine is just off and you need to figure out how far in the cycle it had gotten.

So ... suggestion... please add ‚ÄúPause‚Äù capability to the app

title: No time of day
text: Please fix the problem with the clock. When my Monogram oven is connected to WiFi the clock setting is continually off by 1 hour. When you use the oven clock the majority of time that you‚Äôre in the kitchen, it can become frustrating. Every time I receive notification of an update I anxiously wait to see if it will fix this bug, but alas‚Ä¶it still lags behind by an hour. I‚Äôve had this glorious appliance for just at a year and have never had the clock function with correctly when connected to WiFi

title: Glorified timer
text: There are two types of water/dryer model. Both of them advertise as being usable with  the the app. Set up the app, connected to the network and everything is working fine. Except the model we got does not allow you to start the machines with the app or to extend the dry time. You can keep track of how many dryer sheet you use and how much time is left on a load, which I can do on my phone as well. So basically this app is just a glorified timer unless you have the right  model. Had we known there was a difference in app compatibility we would have bought the more expensive one. Appliances work great just a huge let down on the app side and advertisement side.

title: Great until it‚Äôs not
text: This app was great until it stopped working. It lets you know how much time is left, when a wash cycle is finished, & keeps track of usage. Something changed and it stopped communicating with the appliance. I have one of the latest iPhones, running the latest software, but the app now does not let me input my home network‚Äôs Wi-Fi password, which is required for the app to work. It gets stuck in a loop where keyboard entry becomes impossible. I provided a video recording of the bug to tech support. They asked for a ridiculous amount of personal information to proceed with a possible fix.

title: Horrible
text: 99.9% of the time I don‚Äôt need remote access to my range, but the ONE DAY I need it the app stops working. It worked this morning, but not this afternoon. It says I have no network connection. Yet every other app on my phone has no problem with the network. Neither WiFi nor cellular connections work. The app then gives the most useless suggestion: ‚ÄúIf the problem persists, please contact us‚Äù. Of course there is no contact information give because they don‚Äôt really have a provision for that. It‚Äôs just a platitude. Worse yet, the app the refuses to give ANY access to the app at all. It‚Äôs just dead. This is the worst. If an app can‚Äôt be relied on, why have it at all?

title: Much improved but still lacking remote turning off
text: It is nice that this much improved App allows ovens to be operated remotely but shows cooktops only when anyone of them is on. Turning off of these cooktops remotely would be a very useful feature. This will also improve safety of people and property. If you left home for a trip and not sure whether you left any cooktop on this App if improved can be used to remotely turn off the cooktop.

title: Able to monitor but not control
text:
Getting notifications for when the laundry is done is a great feature. Unfortunately none of the ‚Äúcontrol‚Äù features work. The delay function notes that both the washer and dryer are connected to the app on the machine LED display yet I am unable to perform delayed start from the app. Please fix the app so it will work as described on your website.

Re: GE reply, my initial review mentions that I select delay on the washer/dryer and do not have the ability to control function from the app. That was kind of the entire point of my review.

title: Nice touch to a great appliance
text: As everything seems to be migrating to a more automated application, it‚Äôs good to see large appliances jumping on the bandwagon on that software improvements can be pushed then.  Seeing what‚Äôs happening with the appliance is also positive.  I found it interesting you can set the timer to turn off the appliance and the end of the set time but not on the appliance itself.  You should have both choices in both places‚Ä¶

title: Lack of quality and reliability
text:
I bought a house with GE kitchen appliances so when I needed to replace the range and dishwasher I went with GE so they would match. When I checked reliability online it mostly said they are among the best. NOT TRUE ! My range has a mind of its own. The  duel fuel oven shuts off whenever I open the oven. You can‚Äôt cook food without turning or basting it. Now the range has disconnected itself from the internet. GE notified me as if I did t know. I couldn‚Äôt get it to reconnect so I called support. Of course it worked while he was in the line. Within 5 minutes of him hanging up it disconnected. Again. I‚Äôm done. 
Next time I‚Äôll buy LG!

title: Great App But....
text:
This App is great with my new GE washer and dryer. I like that I get the notifications of how long the washer or dryer will be completed on. I read another review where the customer stated that the extended tumble dry was not working, it hasn‚Äôt worked for me either. But the one thing that I wish it had is for multiple users to be able to use the app sort of like with their own profiles. We‚Äôre 4 at my household but only one person can be connected to the app. 
I would really appreciate if the developer can entertain this option for us consumers :) 

Thank you!

title: Lacking Automatic Notifications
text: It seems the app has skipped what I would think would be a standard by definition of WiFi enabled appliances and the definition/reason for apps in this connected world we live in. I just learned notifications only work if I enable delayed start and control the washer/dryer remotely. In my opinion if I‚Äôm not being notified then there is no need for the app as I don‚Äôt need to start the appliances when I‚Äôm home doing laundry. Otherwise it seems the app does cover a broad spectrum. I strongly suggest/request the ability to select notifications without having to use delayed start/control.

title: Push notifications stopped working
text: App has worked flawless for the past few months with our connected GE washer and dryer, the latest updates seems to have corrupted something with push notifications to the device. I see notifications in the app itself but notifications to my device has stopped and I have checked that all settings on my device itself has not changed allowing notifications from the device itself on IOS.

title: Flaw in App Prevents Connection to GE Washer
text:
I have a GE washer and dryer set and although I was able to get the dryer connected without issue, the app itself will not let me enter the password that is provided on my washer because it contains a number. I have tried different keyboards, pasting the number, etc. and it still prevents me from entering the digit in the password. For reference, my washer model # is: GFW550SSNOWW.

The customer service line is useless and gets you nowhere.

Our home is automated and we are upgrading our kitchen appliances next year to smart appliances. Based on our experience with this app, we will avoid GE products (which is a shame - we have always loved our GE appliances.)

title: GE washer dryer
text:
App is fantastic but my wife was trying to add her account to the system. But the product info doesn‚Äôt show up under her account settings/manage account tab it says no appliances available but still shows it on the Home Screen. So not sure what is going on is there a way to fix this software. 

Still a great application just still think there are bugs in the system. Attention please!!!

title: SmartHQ is a Smart App
text:
I actually love this app. I haven‚Äôt used it to it‚Äôs full potential, and that‚Äôs because there‚Äôs so much you can do within the app.
The one thing that I wish was different about it is the timer through the app.  If you set the timer through the app then it automatically turns the oven off once it‚Äôs done. It would be nice if it gave you an option of the turning the oven off or leaving it on.

title: Buggy scheduler for Opal 2.0
text:
Not even sure where to start, this software is not ready for release. My experience with the Opal 2.0 ice maker:

* Modifying a schedule for Monday will somehow change the length of my schedule on Wednesday.
* Creating a new schedule, if I select each day in order (M, T, W, Th...), the created schedule will not include each day. If I create a schedule and select the days out of order, it appears to select them all.
* Device ignores the schedule I created. Followed the help guide from GE on troubleshooting this, none of which worked. Never turns on or off when it should.
* Making a change to the schedule, waiting a few seconds and trying to make another change, the software will tell you you‚Äôre not connected to the internet. You can‚Äôt exit out of this message either, you have to force close the app and restart it. The only split there for me is to wait 30-60 seconds between each schedule change.

Does not look like this software went to a QA team.

title: It‚Äôs a 5‚≠êÔ∏è for me
text:
Pretty recently I left a 4 star because it didn‚Äôt connect to Alexa, will two days later I get an app update and now I‚Äôm talking to my oven!!! Plus support team reached out after seeing my comment. Customer/ Support Service means the world to me because I strive to provide that to my client within my business.

‚Ä¶.Plus folks are prone to leave bad reviews but quite on the good news. Double oven and the app 5 star perfection ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Handier than I Expected
text: I didn‚Äôt think I needed an app for my washer and dryer, but it has been handier than I expected. It tells you how much time is left on the cycle, it gives you a heads up when they are almost finished. One of the best things is that I was able to schedule service without picking up the telephone or going on line. I was able to set it up right the other app. That alone makes the app worthwhile.

title: Our first ‚ÄúSmart‚Äù appliance
text: Bought the window unit a/c not really considering the wi-fi feature. After the installation and download of the app, I can say that I enjoy the remote controllability it gives. The app also displays the power usage and even graphs the history for the last several days. I‚Äôve been using the system for a bit over a week and I‚Äôm rating it 5 stars for now. If need be, I‚Äôll edit this review.

title: Minimal control
text:
I can see what the range is doing, but I have no control. I can't even turn it off. That would be a neat safety feature.

I see reviews about how this app helps blind users have their independence, but I don't understand how. How do I turn things on? How do I set a temperature or a timer? I already know I can't turn anything off. Whatever else I might be able to do with the app is pointless if I can't have it perform basic operation and safety functions.

UPDATE: I just got a response from the developer and I have to think we‚Äôre looking at completely different apps. The features they describe in their response do not behave the same way for me. The app lets me‚Ä¶
1. get notified when the oven is preheated
2. get notified when my timer has ended.
3. see which burners are on.

That‚Äôs the complete list! I can‚Äôt preheat anything, I can‚Äôt turn anything off, I can‚Äôt turn anything on. This app is basically a thing that makes my phone buzz a few seconds after I hear the oven beep.

Woo. üôÑ

title: Simple, easy to use. Needs improvements.
text:
The app is easy to use and does what you need it to do. However if I can make a suggestion to the developers. The app can see what model my oven is. If there are new features released in a firmware update that is I supported by my model, then do not notify me about it.

You notified me about air fryer mode a few months ago. My oven doesn‚Äôt support it. You notified me about Turkey Mode today, but my model doesn‚Äôt support it. Really upsetting to be notified about something that does not apply. So please suppress those notifications if the oven does not support it.

title: Total garbage
text:
(I used this for a window air conditioner) 

Their registration process tells you when your password meets their requirements turning the red x‚Äôs to green checks, but then tells you it‚Äôs not complex enough after submitting. I‚Äôm ten attempts deep, each ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù their criteria. Absolute garbage, can‚Äôt even use it.

Edits following developer response: 
Thanks for sending to a the generic help page and nothing specific about the issues I mentioned. I managed to get it figured out after waiting a few hours and using the same password. 

I believe you need conditional error messaging and/or to limit how many ‚Äúforgot my password ‚Äú links you‚Äôll send out. 

Anyway, now that I‚Äôm using the app I‚Äôll give it another star. This app is clearly an ok answer to a lot of products, and feels that way. Nothing works great or easy, but gets by. Definitely some things that are missing but gives you some connected capability.

title: Update the instructions, please
text:
The app is very nice - now that I finally have it working. The printed instructions that came with my 3-day-old oven say the oven password can be found on a metal ‚Äútag‚Äù inside the oven. Nope - you have to press ‚Äúconnect‚Äù on the touchpad. No huge problem, but I had to call for help, which took some time.

Another thing - why is the app called SmartHQ‚Äù and not GE something? I could not find it on my own in the App Store without looking at the instructions. Just saying.

title: Junk
text:
I‚Äôve used this app for several years. I only use it to control my oven. The app has never been extremely reliable, but it gets worse and worse. All I want is to remotely turn on the oven so that dinner will be hot when I get home. But half the time it doesn‚Äôt work. (I am not tech illiterate, I know how to troubleshoot a network, etc. it‚Äôs just an unreliable app.) 
And worse, it shows me stupid ads for other smart devices that I don‚Äôt want-‚Äì there‚Äôs no way to turn these ads off. I hate being advertised to when all I want is simple reliable oven control.
Just an example of app bloat and out-of-touch software designers.

title: Great while it worked
text: Receiving notifications when the laundry is completed was immensely helpful and a great feature. Unfortunately, the app stopped working and I have been unable to get it to work again despite deleting my appliances and adding them again. In fact, I‚Äôm now stuck and can‚Äôt get past the logging into the cloud screen. This is incredibly frustrating since we purchased a washer and dryer that were 1k each. Seriously GE, you should be able to do better. What‚Äôs the point of having ‚Äúsmart‚Äù appliances that are seriously stupid and can‚Äôt figure out how to work? I wish we had stuck with Maytag.

title: Love the idea! Hope future updates help it a little.
text:
I was soo excited about the possibilities of this feature. It was part of what made me decide to buy this range. My only complaint is that sometimes I‚Äôve went in to set a temperature to preheat, then it‚Äôs like it has a glitch and resets the temperature.
Burnt some chicken up the other day because I didn‚Äôt realize it did that and had reset the temperature to 490. I‚Äôll have to get in the habit of checking it.

title: GE Stove very little functionality
text:
There‚Äôs little you can do with this app to control your stove. 
One of the best things is that you can look and see if it‚Äôs on as you‚Äôre driving away. 
If you remember to click the button to allow remote control, you can turn it on and set the timer considerably easier than with the touchpad.
And you can turn it off. That‚Äôs about all. 
I wish the name of the app on my iPhone had to words GE in it. SmartHQ never seems like the right app to control my stove.

title: Terrible app
text:
We bought a new house 7 months ago. All of our kitchen appliances are the cafe GE model. We also have smart washer and dryer by GE. The smart features are pretty meaningless. The only one I use is remote preheating of the oven. 
Three days ago the app told me there was an update so I started it. Well something happened and my oven won‚Äôt reconnect to the app. It wouldn‚Äôt be that big of a deal except for the fact that the clock now resets every day. I‚Äôve reset it multiple times and cleared settings. still nothing. If your appliance tell you to download this app I would highly suggest returning the product for any other option. It‚Äôs bad.

title: I love my new Washer even more with app
text: When I saw that our new washer was Wi-Fi ready, I thought, ‚Äúwhat am I gonna do with that, send email to it?‚Äù Turns out I really love it already, after only a month. The app tells me when my laundry is almost done and done. It tells me when the ‚Äòauto-dispenser‚Äô is empty, and I look forward to learning what other controls I‚Äôll have using this app. So far, I love it!

title: Auto brew functionality does not work for coffee maker
text:
I have attempted to setup the auto brew functionality.   I have been unable to get it to work.  I can direct it to brew on demand from the app but not on a schedule 

It is not clear if the app is supposed to sync the time.   It has not for me.  If they are different should the app brew based in phone day and time?  That would be my expectation as that would be the most accurate and the coffee maker has setup for time only while the app lets you pick different schedules for different days. It would be great if it worked

title: Not very usable - turkey mode major fail
text: First experience was it connected ok but appliance did not provide many features. Used it with dishwasher first but about all its good for is letting you know dishwasher is done. Range had a few more features, but the ‚ÄúTurkey mode‚Äù resulted in raw legs an thighs - do not use it! Had to reboot my router and could no longer talk to devices. Tried removing and re-adding - they connect fine but cannot find in cloud. Response to ticket was good but by the time I got it the problem had resolved without my doing anything, so adding back 1 star

title: I expect better when I spend $3,500
text:
This is a terrible app.  I‚Äôm still not hooked up to a GE Washer I bought.  The app takes you through a number of steps to connect to the appliance and then connect to my home WiFi.  Most of the screens you can‚Äôt tell any difference as you hit keys.  The ‚Äúpassword‚Äù supplied by GE uses Vs and Ws abundantly.  No chance of an error between little writing and an app that doesn‚Äôt have any indication of taking data, or waiting on processing or it just went fishing.   

Come On‚Äô    It‚Äôs 2021.   Hire someone decent to help you.    For now I‚Äôll do my laundry the old fashion way and push the buttons on the machine.

title: Good app but issue with notifications
text: I really like the features in this app in terms of monitoring and controlling my appliances. The only problem has been occasionally it stops sending notifications and I have but food in the oven because I did not receive a notification that the timer finished. The solution is to remove the app from your smart phone and reinstall it. But eventually the same problem happens.

title: Very Convenient
text: No complaints.  The app actually works well with the Washer and Dryer and notifies you when laundry has completed the cycle and also when it has been in the washer damp for 30 minutes.  Love it!  You are also notified when the dryer cycle is complete and can add time to it if needed.  It is great because you can be reminded to take out the laundry before it gets wrinkled.  Pretty nice.

title: I love my Smart HQ
text: Love having my washer connected to this app. So far it has let me know not only how much time is left in my wash and when it‚Äôs complete but also let me know there was a reversal of my hot and cold water. It was easily fixed by the installers. Turns out my hot and cold faucets are mislay. I didn‚Äôt really look for a connected washer but I am so happy to have it. The app is very easy to use and set up.

title: Does not give push notifications
text: When I first downloaded the app about 6-7 months ago I was able to get push notifications about when a cycle was done either in the washer or dryer , ever since I have yet to get notifications of when it is done which is sometimes Inconvenient when I‚Äôm doing other chores. Please fix this ASAP. I have tried deleting the app, re-downloading it , disconnecting the wifi from the washer and dryer and re connecting and still nothing.

title: Appliance refuses to pair
text:
Received my air conditioner & was excited to have it added to my smart home. I‚Äôve gone through the pairing process dozens of times and each time the unit successfully connects to my wifi but the app fails to find the unit ‚Äúin the cloud‚Äù, meaning I can‚Äôt do anything with it even though it‚Äôs actually connected to the internet. This is ridiculously frustrating. 

 Update: not sure what changed but the unit finally paired.

title: Quick and easy setup. One small problem.
text:
I recently had 2 new GE Profile wall ovens installed. Connecting them to my WiFi router was fairly easy and both ovens appear in the app and respond instantly to commands. 

The only problem is both ovens appear in the app as ‚ÄúOVEN‚Äù so there is no way to distinguish them in the app. I haven‚Äôt found any way to edit their names so they can be easily distinguished in the app. Am I missing something?

title: Often broken rarely accurate
text:
I have to program and reprogram this to our washer and dryer so many times‚Ä¶ which requires customer support to send you a device that you connect to the washer/dry to clear out the info so it can re add this app. Then you have to send the device back to the company. 
I‚Äôve asked the app to save my info so that I don‚Äôt have to type it in each time I log in‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve been doing a lot of laundry today and now mid way through, the app decided to forget all my info and make me sign in again, but I can‚Äôt because my saved info is missing‚Ä¶ rendering the app useless

title: Works Great
text: Don‚Äôt expect it to do your laundry, wash your dishes and cook dinner for you, but if you want to know when things are done, when a filter needs to be changed or what the status of appliance is, it does the job.  I needed some help initially to get my first appliance connected, but support quickly resolved it. I now have four devices connected with no issues.

title: Waiting on software update
text:
I was told there was a software update to an airfryer.  I am still waiting.  When that happens, I will give you 5 stars!

I received the update and am enjoying the air fry feature.  It takes a little adjustment to timing and temperature, but the amount of food I can cook at one time is worth it.  The only problem I see is the browning is not even.

title: Fairly simple app. Not all features work.
text:
The app is fairly simple. Let‚Äôs you know when washer or dryer are 5 minutes from complete and when they have completed their cycles. You can even open the app and see what stage your washer is in.

The dryer has an extended tumble feature which I used to use a lot. If the dryer was done while I was away I‚Äôd set it for extended tumble via the app, and when I got back home my clothes wouldn‚Äôt be all balled up and wrinkled. Now that feature doesn‚Äôt work.

title: Super frustrating
text:
The app worked well for maybe a month. Now, for going on 3 months it flat out will not notify me at all about anything. 
I‚Äôve uninstalled and reinstalled the app, reset my phone, tried it on a different device, disconnected then reconnected my appliance. Nothing. So frustrating. 
It‚Äôs constantly saying it needs to be updated. So I go to update the app, it says it‚Äôs done. Then when I go back into it. It says the same thing. I don‚Äôt know what happened but I‚Äôm very much over it. I wish I could go back to the original app I was using prior to them making me switch to this awful one.

title: Great system, unexpected changes
text: We love our oven. Everything from preheating on the app without being home to its ease of double oven functions. Our only CON came after a recent download when the timer was updated. It no longer has a continuous ringing to alert us it has finished. We have missed the soft one time alert and our food has over cooked on multiple occasions. If they fixed this error, we would have given 5 stars.

title: Color??
text:
cant figure out why this app is in greyscale but it does have features that are helpful. i have a full sweet of GE smart appliances and find the auto order of detergent and dishwasher pods to be uber convenient. i would like to think they could do this with the coffee maker (filters and grounds) as well. 

program in some color as well as an auto order feature for the coffee maker and now your onto something!!

title: The focus of this app is advertising
text: The main purpose of having this app, at least for me, was to get status notifications for my washer/dryer.  After the initial setup, those notifications were delivered, albeit at completely wrong times (most times several hours after cycle completion). Now those notifications no longer even show up. I figured I would delete the appliances from the app and add them again to perhaps fix the notification bug but there does not seem to be a way to do that.

title: Great Pair w GE Opal Ice Maker
text: I‚Äôm enjoying the app so far and it makes for a great pairing with my GE Profile Opal Ice Maker 2.0.  My wishlist for improving the app is to give option to put light on a timer. I enjoy having light on in the evenings in kitchen, but have to remember to manually shut off before bed, turn back on in AM.  Also, push notifications or an app log as to times when ice maker is making ice, and for how long.  I look forward to subsequent app versions!

title: SmartHQ app fails but compatibility is amazing
text:
Status of dryer crashes when dryer is paused, meaning it displays time, status, etc., before you pause your dryer the status never leaves off the pause stage, even after restarting your dryer. Want to disconnect and reset the app, to leave the current status but can not. All of this after an update. Needs work...status stays on pause even when the dryer has started over.

Sincerely,

Anwar Lee Moore

title: App glitching
text: I purchased a washer and dryer about a month ago and they were delivered at different times. I was able to connect my dryer with no problem. However now I am trying to connect my washer and the app will not let me type in my Wi-Fi password. The keyboard pops up but when I type nothing happens. I have deleted and reinstalled the app several times with no success. This seems to be a glitch within the app. It is very frustrating to pay so much money for an appliance and not be able to utilize all of its functions because the app is poorly developed.

title: Slow, clunky, and latest update is UNUSABLE
text: I'm so glad they added "Turkey option" in their latest app update, too bad they had to BREAK the air conditioning functionality! This app is horribly designed; beyond clunky, using this app feels like trying to use one of the first internet appliances back in like 2004. It. Takes. SO long to connect to anything, and that's if it's successful at all. App frequently just stops working for no reason. It could not be more painfully clear that these manufacturers made this app as an afterthought to sell more hardware with fancy buzzwords like "smart" and "connected".

title: Only one user per appliance? Disrespectful design
text:
This app is a hassle to set up and has no easy way to find or start a family sharing mode. Multiple people should be able to share remote control of appliances. 

The privacy opt out process is cumbersome, and the push for sales in the app are terrible. Sends message that customer is a mark for more sales rather than someone to serve. 

Accomplished remote control of appliance, earning two stars instead of one. But experience will cause me to look for other brands for next smart appliance.

title: Good app
text:
Hello, we purchased our washed/dryer months before taking ownership of our new home. We read up on all the features it had and were aware that we could use it in conjunction with the phones for notifications. The only thing that I wish it had was the ability to start/stop and possibly add time instead of just knowing when it was working and when it stopped. 
Great app doh

title: Excellent App
text:
This honestly makes my spoiled lifestyle so much better! I use it with a 24,000 BTU AC window unit.

I LOVE how I can set multiple Time Settings for each day, the week, the weekend, etc. I WFH in my shed and it really makes Spring-Fall a much more pleasurable experience.

The only thing I do not like is the temperature setting - again very spoiled small issue that may be the appliance not the App. It seems that I have to set the unit to 1 or 2 degrees colder than the temperature I want in order for the desired temp to arrive. Part of this is because of the thermostat line being where the warmer air is sucked in vs external. But honestly, that‚Äôs a first world crisis. 

If you want Beta Testers for updates, count on me.

title: For a washer dryer it‚Äôs not very helpful
text: If you like getting a notification on your phone that cycles are done. This app is great. If you see expecting some actual control options, you got nothing. I can‚Äôt do anything but run a no heat tumble for the dryer. That‚Äôs it. I‚Äôd actually like to be able to run the same load with some slightly different settings from the app, but can‚Äôt. Maybe that‚Äôs a liability hazard to not be present with the washer dryer and run it. All I know is that this app is pretty much a waste of time if you are connecting a washer dryer.

title: Awful - doesn‚Äôt work - don‚Äôt download
text:
Bought a new cafe refrigerator and wanted to connect my iPhone 12 Pro to it. Downloaded this app, tried to sync with the fridge via the passwords provided in the settings on the fridge, when it gets to selecting my home WiFi network on this app it sits forever on loading the next page and never advances. I tried to click the ‚ÄúUPD ID‚Äù hyperlink instead of entering the password from the fridge‚Ä¶ it goes to a black screen and then goes nowhere. 
This app is full of glitches and bugs, and simply does not work. 
Don‚Äôt download it - it‚Äôs a waste of time.

title: Disappointed
text:
I purchased a appliance with WiFi and was so excited to finally be in the 21st century!!
Started out ok I guess then I had to purchase the app to enable the feature I just paid for and I still can‚Äôt find the amount my account was charged for the privilege of using the dam thing. I figured I might as well use it since I‚Äôm being charged for it and it wants permission to add or delete at its discretion along with personal information they have no business asking for. 
My advice it‚Äôs low score on the app store is low for a reason. find another app and blow this one off

title: Writing again because this update created a safety issue!
text:
I figured out what‚Äôs going on. The remote feature NO LONGER WORKS IF CONTROL LOCK IS ON! That is absolutely ridiculous!  The lock is a safety/protection feature, and the remote function should work regardless of whether control lock is on. If this is an intentional change, it is ridiculous and a significant safety problem. That needs to be changed back to the original setting.

Also just noticed that the remote enable now stays on after the convection cooking when the door is opened. That also never was the case before. I don‚Äôt know whether that is a problem or not. 

Finally, I did report this to the GE smart devices services. They took notes, but it was clear to me that who knows when these issues will be resolved. 

I will just have to keep my oven unlocked and try to avoid any safety issue until this is fixed.

title: Does not show actual temperature
