text: We had a GE Arctica refrigerator and one thing it did was show the actual temperature in all the compartments. I was surprised that our new Cafe unit does not show it on the display and neither in the app. It should be straightforward to publish this information to the app or to the appliance screen via a software update. Waiting for the update. Otherwise the app has no other benefit vs setting controls on the refrigerator itself other than LED controls.

title: Been a nightmare so far
text:
Using the SmartHQ app has been a pain so far. It took terribly long to get my appliances connected. The worst problem was that the app gave very poor feedback as to what was happening. Couldn‚Äôt tell if it was working and I just needed to wait or if it was locked up and needed to start over, or if there was something I needed to do next to proceed. Finally got all three air conditioners connected after an hour or so of retrying and waiting. 

Was able to turn them on and off a few times. What a let down to discover the app doesn‚Äôt tell me what the temperature of the room is.

Now a couple days later when I wanted to use the app to start my air conditioners, when I open the app it says ‚Äúan error has occurred, if problem continues, please contact us‚Äù and the screen becomes unresponsive. Doesn‚Äôt even give contact info. What a joke. 

The problem continues.

title: They want so much info from you!
text: You First and Last name, street address, email to create an account.  They want your home network password so your device can connect to your home network??? Why not just be able to control the appliances without giving it access to your home network?? Like Bluetooth?  I‚Äôve not been able to connect to the appliance using this app and I‚Äôve spent the last 3 hours trying different passwords, even though I have the right password in front of me.

title: Zero stars
text:
This is by far the worst app as well as the so called team that supports the app. Originally they replied to my first and second email but once they realized they had no answer to fix the network error message I keep getting and the no water usage counter not showing, they completely dismissed all emails. I have sent several other emails asking for assistance and no response at all. Does anyone have the same issues with this useless app for their water softener?
I mean, just look at the ratings for this app, if that‚Äôs not obvious then I‚Äôm not sure what else to say.

title: Worked great up until a couple of weeks ago
text: App had worked fine for the last 6 months.  I then got a notification via email that my oven had been offline for like a week.  I checked and it appeared online, but I could not control it or view its status.  My washer and dryer were also both offline.  I tried removing the devices and then re-adding, but I can‚Äôt get any of the devices added.  It gets stuck in the finishing up stage.  I have tried with two iPhones and an iPad and all have the same issue.  Hopefully they will update the app soon.

title: Awesome Feature
text: This is a really convenient feature. I can turn on the oven, let‚Äôs say on the way home from work to reheat something or have it ready to cook a pizza. I work a lot of nights so this is super handy. You can also choose between cooking modes and temperature, as well using the Smart HQ. Overall I‚Äôm really pleased with this range and oven.

title: Slow
text: I use this app for my window AC unit and it honestly is so slow to set up I thought it was broken. Not only that but if I have to unplug it I have to go through the ENTIRE setup process again and it‚Äôs almost unbearable. When it‚Äôs set up you‚Äôre good to go and it works pretty quick and seamless but the setup process is honestly really really bad. Like I never write negative reviews and I felt like I needed to share this, bad.

title: Mostly annoying and a bit useless
text:
Setup is arduous.  Recently, the app couldn‚Äôt find my dryer.  I tried removing and adding my dryer again.  The dryer is on my WiFi network when I look and the WiFi light on the dryer is solid.  The app gives a message of, ‚Äúsorry, please try reloading the app‚Äù.  So far, the SmartHQ app has failed to reconnect to my dryer, even though it is on my network.  All I use the app for is the notification that the washing or drying is done, cause that‚Äôs all it does, unless you count trying to solicit products. 

What a pain just to get an alert!  Shame, shame‚Ä¶

title: Happy so far
text: We only have one appliance linked to this app so far.  Hope to add 2 more.  Happy with the app so far, but it‚Äôs only been one week.  Glad to see recipes out there and never had an induction or air fryer capabilities before so this is a learning experience for us. Looking forward to learning more and cooking better and healthier foods !

title: Unable to Have Multiple Users on App
text: I recently purchased a front loader washer and dryer and found that the app was ok. Clunky but it did what was needed. My housemate wanted to also utilize the app, especially for notification and tumble drying but we can only connect one device at a time and the pairing process is painful and a huge waste of time. Is there any way we can set up a household account so that we can both receive notifications? This isn‚Äôt 1950‚Äìmultiple people take care of laundry nowadays.

title: Warranty
text: I love my opal ice but GE service center is almost impossible to get ahold of ablnd whe you do they tell you they don‚Äôt work on those ice makers so I worked on it myself and found a screw in the flow line from the resuvar that could only been placed there during manufacturing that tells me quality control is poor but it‚Äôs fixed and I‚Äôm enjoying the ice now

title: Does what I wanted!
text: We use the app for the appliances in our second home. It works as I expected and allows me to check to make sure everything is working when we are not there. I‚Äôve only lost connection to one of the appliances once. I like being able to control the range remotely when I need to.

title: Terrible
text: This app is worthless for the Opal 2.0 nugget ice maker. It‚Äôs August 2021 and I have the exact same complaints as the reviews from December 2020. The schedule doesn‚Äôt follow what you‚Äôve set and any changes crashes the app, saying you‚Äôre not connected to your network even though you are. It‚Äôs highly frustrating paying extra money for features you can‚Äôt even use. GE needs to fix this ASAP or back to the store this thing goes for the cheaper model without the [non-working] bells ‚Äòn whistles.

title: So far so good
text: I have only been using the app for a few weeks now, but have been very happy with it. I like the alerts for laundry, allows me to more efficiently monitor loads. I also like the alerts for the oven reaching temperature. I used the app to preheat my oven remotely once, and that worked as well. I did not feel any need to connect my refrigerator.

title: Pretty Good
text: Could be better. Love the notifications when they work. But l think it‚Äôs my phone not limited to this app. (Having trouble with lots of apps though I‚Äôve been through settings a ton) Wish you could cancel a cycle and wished it was more seamless with HomeKit. But those are my only two complaints after a couple weeks. Will update if my feelings change.

title: Needs work, super annoying to use
text: Connected my GE washer and dryer to the app. The washer goes offline every few days or so and I keep having to add it back, which is laborious and annoying. With the dryer, while it has stayed connected to the app since the first pairing, the app tells me that the dryer needs an update every single time I use the app, despite me accepting the update every time it asks (and waiting with the app open/not able to use my phone for the several minutes it takes to do said update). Needs some bugs works out for sure!!

title: Flaky app for GE Cafe oven fails
text:
Most of the time the app fails to connect to the GE Cafe oven it is meant to control. I have gone through two rounds of uninstalling and reinstalling and connecting. It works for a bit. But then gets into a state where it simply reverts to showing a support screen any time I try to check the status of or control the oven. 

I use smart apps for Wyze bulbs, a garage door monitor, remote camera and doorbell and a smart lock. And those work perfectly fine.

This app in contrast is simply useable. Perhaps it‚Äôs the Oven itself that disconnects. But either way the app is virtually useless for a GE Cafe oven.

title: Cannot have multiple users for household appliances, ridiculous.
text: I‚Äôm now using the ‚ÄúSmartHQ‚Äù app and I had been able to use multiple devices for multiple users on the GE Caf√© app before it was replaced, now it seems that I can‚Äôt? Why? Is this no longer possible? If true, that‚Äôs awful, and is a GIANT and OBVIOUS mistake which is going to ruin a lot of people‚Äôs user experience. I really would like to have both me AND my wife use the WiFi capabilities of these products. Crazy right. Somehow they missed that and so far, only one person is possible. COMPLETELY unacceptable.

title: Could Be Good
text: We have had the same issues as others with the double wall oven. We tried to connect to more than one device and it kicked off the one device that was connected to it. Then we couldn‚Äôt even connect the original device to it because of what previous reviewer stated that it goes in circles asking you to connect to something you can‚Äôt connect to with the LCD. I will have to try connecting to a dishwasher like that person and see if that works.

title: Helpful Hassle
text: Nice feature to have so you can know when you‚Äôre laundry is done. My washer is in the basement so it saves me trips up and down stairs in the rain or at night- drag. However it is a nightmare to program your phone. It seems to have A LOT of issues connecting to WiFi during the setup. Something for the GE tech department to troubleshoot and repair for future updates.

title: Turkey mode needs to be a permanent option
text:
This made our thanksgiving even better.  The turkey was so moist and better than many years past.  Highly recommend that Smart HQ develop a prime rib one as well and always have as an available option.

I would use it all the time.

title: App Crashes
text:
App was very limited in its functionality for the water softener. You could see real time GPM usage but no historical data/trends. It had daily total gallons used but very limited historical info. So much missed potential for data and functionality. One good feature was the continuous water alert. 

Now the latest update makes the app crash when doing anything at all with the softener (control tab). All of the other tabs remain accessible except for the one focused on the softener - the only reason for having the app.

title: App - Convection Range
text:
I've tried/used most features in the last 9 months. 

Pros: 
Superior control of heat w/inductive burners. 
No baked on crud around burners!!
Even & correct oven temperature. 
Notices sent to phone on pre-heat & timer. 
Temperature probe cooking. 
Clock reading internet and being accurate after a power outage!!!!

Cons:
Broiler not working with door cracked. 
   (Burnt garlic bread way too many times)
Soft scratched stainless trim over control panel. 
Burners on stove top turning off to quickly when lifting a pan. 
Burner controls way too easy to rotate. 
   (Hip all to often adjusting temperatures)

App's functionality is a relay of a chime and when phone is charged and in my pocket does allow a degree of freedom from the kitchen.

title: Busy? Time short? This can help
text:
If you are a busy parent, there are times when every min matters. 

Not having to add detergent to every load, not having to guess how much time is needed to dry, not having to guess when the washing machine will finish, saves time!

(Text)- washing machine 5 mins from done.
(Text)-washing machine done
Throw load in dryer, push start, done!  The washing machine has already told the dryer what to expect, hence how to dry it.
Virtually no down time!

Out n about? Text reminders about laundry waiting so you don‚Äôt forget and leave it sit overnight.

The only thing missing (or I havent figured out yet)- tell the laundry to run another rinse cycle, or tell the dryer to tumble cool to help prevent wrinkling.

title: Not really functional
text:
My wall oven has tons of great features. But the only feature I can utilize from the app is turning it on. And now it doesn‚Äôt even send me notifications when it‚Äôs pre-heated or the timer is finished...I actually have to open the app to see that information. Also, the scan to cook feature would be great if it had ANY products we use. Not even a Totino‚Äôs Party Pizza is on their list!

I just want it to have functional notifications and I would be happy!!!

title: Working app just left out Siri control options
text: As people get divided into Alexa, google I am surprised that Siri controls are available. More & more as people upgrade their homes with smart objects such as lighting, thermostats & other appliances the option for Siri to help control them becomes more & more of a wanted option. Hopefully there will be a future update to introduce this.

title: Ice nuggets at your leisure
text: I absolutely love this device. It make the ice so much faster than other devices. It‚Äôs very easy to use and works quietly and quickly. I would buy it again and even recommended it to my grandmother and she bought one too.  The Opal 2.0 is an amazing device. I highly recommend this device! I love the Opal!

title: Stuck finding appliance
text: I have used this app to try and add my monogram double oven and everything seems to go fine until the process stalls out at ‚Äústuck finding appliance in the cloud.‚Äù  The oven connects to my 2.4 GHz network and lets me turn on remote control however the app never successfully adds the oven. I know the oven is properly connected because I can actively see the DHCP reservation for it along with it being listed as a client connected to the nearby access point.  Not impressed...

title: Great unit
text: So far I love this thing. Living in central Kansas. Have a 30 by 40 shop, (note that roof is not finished) just the white insulation from contractors that built the thing. It‚Äôs 100 degrees outside with about 82% humidity. It‚Äôs 82 degrees inside with a couple fans in each corner on low. Yeah it‚Äôs not 72 but in still feels great in here working on a car or doing a welding project.

title: Easy to use, great for connected appliances
text: Easy to navigate app. Wood easy to set up for my connected window AC in a third floor finished attic space. Wanted something connected so we didn‚Äôt have to constantly keep going up and down to set and see temps as the space isn‚Äôt used frequently. This paired with my smart 12,000 BTU GE AC is perfect!

title: Getting WiFi to connect with app‚Ä¶
text: The app is pretty easy to use, but at least on our a.c., I had to tap the WiFi button so that it came on (but wasn‚Äôt flashing), hold the button until it turned off, then tap it again when it did begin to flash. That was the only thing holding up connection. After that, it‚Äôs very easy.

title: Useful notifications
text: So far this is working well with my GE oven. I really like that the notifications come to my watch though having a dedicated watch app would be better. Also would like it to chime when a cooking alarm goes off. I‚Äôve got sounds enable but while a banner comes up it is silent. Really necessary as the chime on the oven is super quiet even on its loudest setting.

title: Alerts are great
text:
I really enjoy getting notifications on my phone that my washing machine is 5 minutes from finishing, finished, and when it‚Äôs been sitting too long. 
The app claims to count laundry loads and keeps a chart, which would be a fun feature, but it misses loads every 3 or 4, so the count is inaccurate and therefore pointless. 
Still a cool app, I‚Äôm only using it for my washing machine.

title: Like the App would like to see one small change.
text: I like the app so far it has not given me any problems. I have 3 items connected thru it. A refrigerator, a dishwasher and an oven. The only thing I would like to see them change is on the oven when the timer is set in the app it counts up yet on the oven the timer counts down. I‚Äôd like the app to count down as well.

title: Connecting to WiFi
text: Recently had to upgrade my router. Stronger faster better router and speed. When setting up GE refrigerator on new network it says looking for new network but it spins FOREVER looking, never kicks out or allows any other options. I suspect this is a bug from update 3 days ago.  Hoping that‚Äôs it. Will reach out to service next week but I think this might be a software issue with app.

title: I am enjoying this app
text:
Sends me notifications when cycles are completed and 5
Minutes before. My laundry is in the garage; so it saves me trips. Very handy app. It just uses more battery, but works very well. It worked right the first time with home WiFi setup.
It have it working with GE ultra fresh front load washer and dryer!

title: Useless
text:
Downloaded the App with my new fridge since we didn‚Äôt have an option to get it without this IoT feature, and was curious to see what ‚Äòfeatures‚Äô it had.

I can check my ice levels, remotely adjust my temperature, and dim the back light. I have never once thought I needed or wanted any of these features. This is completely pointless IoT for the sake of marketing it as a ‚ÄúSmart Fridge‚Äù. I can only imagine how many hundreds of dollars this bumped up the price of my fridge for something no one asked for or wanted.

Why do this to your consumers?

title: Shows info but won‚Äôt let us change settings
text: We bought this a/c unit specifically so we could monitor and adjust settings while we‚Äôre out of the house and the app doesn‚Äôt allow it. We go into our appliance and we can select different modes, fan speed, etc. and select ‚Äúset‚Äù but it doesn‚Äôt change to what we selected. I called support and was told to reinstall. It works for a day then back to the same. Incredibly frustrating!

title: Doesn‚Äôt connect to WiFi
text:
The main issue though is that the app/AC refuse to connect to my WiFi.  Usually when a device connects to WiFi it asks for a password, but this does not.  It just says there was an error try again.  Level 2 troubleshooting involves resetting my whole home network, then resetting my whole phone internet settings.  Fun!  

Also, they ask for a ton of personal information that an AC would never need. And it is a pain to sign out of all the partners they share your info with.

title: Works, but slow
text: I recently updated to this app per customer service, I had no indication that a new app was out. This app once you connect your appliances, does not display serial numbers or mac addresses for your records. I had an issue with the connection stickers being damaged from some tape on my unit. Lost the information for linking it to my smart hub. But overall it works, but it‚Äôs slow

title: Smart home
text: I‚Äôve had the dryer and the app for about 2 weeks now. This is convenient in that I can see how long a dryer cycle has left and the app notifies me when there is 5 minutes left and when the cycle is done. I also like the feature that allows me to turn the dryer on without heat if I can‚Äôt get the laundry out right away.

title: Notifications
text:
If I could change anything it would be ‚Äúdamp laundry has been in your washer for an hour‚Äù!   I often brush off the first half hour and then forget altogether! 

This Includes the dryer half hour  notification.  Half hour only just isn‚Äôt enough when I‚Äôm busy!!

title: Fantastic Site
text: It‚Äôs great to be able to control your Smart Appliances from your phone. You receive alerts if there is a problem with the appliance. You can run the appliance from a remote station and you are always in control. It‚Äôs a fabulous support and makes life a little easier.

title: Leaves a lot to be desired by Voiceover users
text: This app is a nightmare to navigate for a Voiceover user. The elements do not make sense and are not labeled properly and do not match up with what a sighted user would see when navigating the same app. Plus, there is limited interaction for those using a screen reader. For example, not all toggles and other elements to interact with are as accessible as they would be for a sighted user. Hopefully, an update will be available to remedy the inability to navigate properly and interact properly with this app.

title: Love this App
text: This app gives me freedom to focus on other things and brings Efficiency to the laundry function in our home.  I love the replenishment feature.  I wish I could pair the controls and make changes to some of the controls during the cycle.  Otherwise, I‚Äôm totally satisfied with my unit.

title: Last update is nice improvement.
text: Under normal conditions the app is five stars.  Latest update resolved a number of issues.  What needs to improve is for the oven when there is a power outage and WiFi does not reconnect.  The app does not do a good job and you have to start from scratch as I have to erase some network settings on phone.

title: Great machine. Needs software update
text: The machine works absolutely flawless. However I am a single man and don‚Äôt need it to be continually making ice all day long. If there could be a button pushed ota on the app to let me stop making ice but leaving the machine on and keeping the ice already made frozen. That would be awesome. Other then that the machine is worth the money.

title: Love being able to check washing status from anywhere
text: I love that I know the status of my washer and dryer from anywhere I also like the reminder that I need to get the clothes out of the washer if they‚Äôve been in there for more than a few hours

title: Appalling privacy/marketing
text:
Just putting my ‚Äúsmart‚Äù air conditioner on wifi requires logging into the app. That requires an account, which REQUIRES name, address, email address, phone, and access to GPS location! 

I bit the bullet and provided all this against my better judgment. The AC is now on wifi, but it still won‚Äôt add to HomeKit after a week of trying. I give two stars instead of one because it may be a hardware issue rather than just the bad app.

title: It‚Äôs ok, I expected more.
text:
I definitely expected more ease in adding products. I also expected it to make life easier in some kind of way. I don‚Äôt see where it does that. It seems to simply duplicate what already exists. 

The appliances notify and at the same time, the app notifies you. So far, I don‚Äôt see how it has enhanced owning and/or using the product. 

After 2 years, I still have 2 other appliances to add and I don‚Äôt see why I should bother.

title: It NAGS ME!
text:
Smart IQ is an ingenious service that nags me when I‚Äôm doing laundry. AND I LOVE IT! 
I was always getting into other things and forgetting my laundry. Now  I can depend on this app. to remind me - even after 30 minutes. My laundry gets washed and dried and I can be confident that clothes will be ready when I want them and with less wrinkles.

title: WiFi access not what I hoped for
text: The purpose of me downloading the app was I expected to be able to do everything from my phone remotely, not just monitor. It would be a lot better if I could load the washer before going to work and from the convinence of my phone I could start the laundry right before heading home. That way by the time I got home I would have a load ready to throw into the dryer. The WiFi is pointless if your not at home.

title: My GE Washer & Dryer
text: I use to love the SmartHQ app. But with this new update I constantly have relog into my geappliance website & reconnect it to the SmartHQ app. And now all the sudden w/our new dryer it‚Äôs now telling me when our clothes are done drying even though it‚Äôs connected to WIFI. I can‚Äôt figure out what is going on. And that was the whole reason we got this set of washer/dryers.

title: Very Nice
text: I started having issues with the Comfort App and wrote a review on my issue. It took about a month but I received a reply telling me to download this app instead. I signed in and it seamlessly paired with my window unit. I do like the look of this app much better than the other. Great job!

title: Cafe 27.6 French Door App
text: Setting up was glitchy. Several attempts and finally worked, but no idea why. Displays filter ‚Äòokay‚Äô or ‚Äònot okay‚Äô, which is pretty basic. You can easily change temperature settings, lighting level and sound. The app will warn you if the doors open or if temp rises. Not bad. We‚Äôll see if the filter communication improves with the chipped XWFE filter when the preinstalled XWF needs to be changed.

title: App for Washing Machine
text: This app is amazing.  We love our new top load washing machine.  It has a larger capacity, and thanks to the app and machine capabilities my laundry days are shorter than in the past.   My phone alerts me when it‚Äôs down, in the past I got busy and forgot!   You will sure love this feature!

title: Can‚Äôt use it
text: Not happy. It won‚Äôt allow me to add my Cafe refrigerator. It sees my double oven with air fry with no problems. Takes me in circles without allowing me to add fridge. I wrote support - their response was 5 million questions about installation address; serial numbers; version numbers and good lord forget it. Too many technology problems for me. Shame. I paid a lot of money for the appliances and it would be nice to use all of the features but I don‚Äôt have the patience anymore for this when it doesn‚Äôt download easily.

title: Makes life easier!
text: Back in the day nobody thought an app could make washing clothes easier and less stressful. SmartHQ does that for us. It‚Äôs amazing how minor the time left notifications might seem but they make a huge difference as were planning our day

title: Okay but flawed
text: I have it connected to the GE Nugget 2.0 ice maker. I like that I can control the ice maker from my phone- although totally unnecessary.  I like that the app tells me when it needs to be cleaned. I like the idea of being able to set up a schedule for when I want the ice maker to make ice; however, I haven‚Äôt been able to find how to delete a schedule to creat a new one. title: Can‚Äôt share with family members?
text: I have several ‚Äúsmart‚Äù appliances and for most of them I am able from my main account to invite family members to get alerts and more or less be sub-accounts under my account and have a lot of the same functionality. This app doesn‚Äôt seem to have that option. So, it doesn‚Äôt seem like I can share this account with family members. If true, seems like a big miss.

title: Love this smart oven!

title: Great App

I love SmartHQ!

The alerts for when to get new detergent is really helpful

title: Tech support

title: Seems to work okay

title: Smart App could do more

As a work around, I‚Äôve had to disable time sync, but it‚Äôd be nice if it actually worked

title: Great for oven

title: Over Flow

Thank you!

title: Love it
text: I love the washer. It has a cycle for all my laundry needs. I love the air fresh cycle where it airs it out so the washer doesn‚Äôt get smelly like many front loaders. title: Like an old app from 10 years ago

title: GE Cafe series wall oven
text:
I‚Äôve had my new oven For a few weeks now and I really enjoy the smart connection to IPhone

5 Starts

title: GE App

title: An app that connects to appliances should work on a LAN.

title: Severely lacking

title: Most used function
text:
The app is used multiple times everyday. The control to initiate heating of water is small and since it‚Äôs the most used function on the app, it should be more pronounced. 
It would be beneficial to me if the heating schedule allowed more options.

title: Fantastic Potential
text:
This app has tremendous potential. I love what it can do, mostly what it could do.

I would suggest working on the GUI to modernize and streamline it. I cannot add the serial number for my washer so it says ‚Äúundefined‚Äù. I would like to be able to remotely have the washer vent, but it does not allow me to do so. The update feature is great but it‚Äôs clunky at best. Please refine this app done.

title: What is the point of this app
text: I was excited to have the wifi option on this washer but was ultimately disappointed when all I can do is monitor the washer and it lets me know when a load is done. I would like to add a tumble if wash isn‚Äôt moved to the dryer by a certain amount of time. I would also like to start it before I head home from work after loading it in the morning.

title: Works once you get it connected
text: Difficult to connect to wifi and appliance but after multiple attempts finally got my oven connected to the app. The app is cool once you get past the linking process.

title: Great app
text: We just purchased a GE washer that connects via this app to our network and iphones.  It has worked well and notifies us as the washer gets closer to finishing the cycle and at completion.  Very nice feature.

title: Notification issues
text: I never used to have these issues with the old app, but ever since GE started using smarthq, notifications always stop working. The fix for it is logging out of the app and logging back in. Sometimes it doesn‚Äôt work and I have to uninstall and reinstall the app. It is extremely annoying and that needs to be fixed.

title: Can‚Äôt connect to Shortcuts or HomeKit
text: This gets one star from me, because it doesn‚Äôt support at least Shortcuts on the iPhone. It would get three stars if it did, because it also doesn‚Äôt support HomeKit. Honestly, it costs five dollars for an entire computer the size of a stick of gum, complete with WiFi connectivity. There isn‚Äôt any excuse these days for poor options regarding connectivity.

title: Watch out when ordering parts
text: I used the app to purchase a water filter for my Monogram fridge and based on my account and appliance it preselects the filter to order.  But. they loaded the wrong filter into the system for my fridge. Which since all the info is loaded into the account means they wasted time and money sending me the wrong one.

title: Customer Service
text:
I. Allied the 1800 number, due to having issues with connecting to my home wifi.  Jonathan took my call.  He was fantastic!! He had my issue resolved in 15 mins.  Kuddos to Jonathan.  

Thank you,
J. Pina 
6/3/21

title: Love it
